page.title: 04THE QUEEN'S VISIT
page.content: It was a cold and misty day at Oakham. All the Oakham students were waiting expectantly for the big moment. The{Queen}had accepted an invitation to come to{Oakham School}to celebrate its quatercentenary. Soon a cheer spread through the pupils. A convoy of six large cars drove up Deanscroft drive. The large swarm of security officers keeping their eyes peeled for anything suspicious. At last the car door swung open and out stepped the Queen, who was then taken to see a girls' boarding house, while the Duke met some members of the{Duke {of Edinburgh}award scheme. After this the couple moved onto the new{Oakham {Theatre,}which the Queen was to open formally. After lunch with the school in the Ashburton Hall the Queen and the Duke left. An enjoyable day !
